intro: Seseli hippomarathrum, commonly known as the horse-marathrum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Seseli hippomarathrum is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator of ecological change in its environment.
